data.title: Former Dutch prime minister Dries van Agt and his wife, Eugenie, both 93, died “hand in hand” earlier this month, according to a statement...
data.meta_description:
60K likes, 1,118 comments - washingtonpost on February 13, 2024: "Former Dutch prime minister Dries van Agt and his wife, Eugenie, both 93, died “hand in hand” earlier this month, according to a statement from the Rights Forum, a pro-Palestinian organization that Dries van Agt created. They chose to die by what is known as “duo euthanasia” — a growing trend in the Netherlands, where a small number of couples have been granted their wish to die in unison in recent years, usually by a lethal dose of a drug.

“I feel like it’s kind of beautiful, honestly, that you’ve lived your life together, you both happen to be gravely ill without a chance of getting better, you’re ready to go, and you would like to go together,” said Maria Carpiac, director of the gerontology program at California State University at Long Beach. When it comes to the right to choose one’s own death, the Netherlands is “kind of the model” for any U.S. legislation on the topic, she said.

Read more through the link in our bio.".
